intro: Gasteranthopsis hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy bladderpod, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in racemes. The plant produces distinctive, inflated pods that resemble bladders, giving it its common name. It is native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, and thrives in dry, open habitats. Gasteranthopsis hirsuta is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments.
